Hi,

I need help with doing a particular thing in JUnit. Any help would b=
e
highly appreciated.

I am using Junit to test a big application. The appl=
ication has
several modules that further have specific APIs. To test the wh=
ole
application =96 I have a scenario in which I use a class for each
modul=
e. This class inherits the TestCase Class of Junit framework and
contains t=
est methods wherein each method corresponds to an API of the
module. (I hop=
e all this doesn't sound too confusing).

Now I need the flexibility of tes=
ting only some particular APIs, i.e.,
I need to call only certain test meth=
ods from the class that inherits
the TestCase class. Is there a functionali=
ty in Junit that can enable
me to do that? I know I can add test cases to a=
 suit but is there a
functionality to add particular test methods to the Te=
st case?

I am explaining this with an example here in case it is still not=
 clear =96

Big application
	Module1
		API1
		API2
	Module2
		API1
		API2

=
BigTestSuite (inherits junit.TestSuite)
	Module1TestCase (class that inheri=
ts junit.TestCase)
		testAPI1()
		testAPI2()
	Module2TestCase (class that i=
nherits junit.TestCase)
		testAPI1()
		testAPI2()

Now I need a functionali=
ty wherein when I run the test suite =96 I can
dynamically run testAPI1() t=
o Module1TestCase if it is required to run
only this test OR I could run te=
stAPI2() and testAPI1() both if that
is required. I cannot hard-code this a=
nywhere. 

Can I somehow do this in Junit?

Please help!
Thanks
